thread.title: Man killed in El Paso is SWLA native, family says
thread.title_full: Man killed in El Paso is SWLA native, family says

author: @KPLC7News
title: Man killed in El Paso is SWLA native, family says
text:
Man killed in El Paso is SWLA native, family says
EL PASO, Texas (KPLC) - El Paso police are investigating a homicide near Fort Bliss, a Texas military base, and a Southwest Louisiana family identified the victim as a Sulphur native.
Kameryn LeBert, of Sulphur, said the victim is her brother, Larry Donnell Lacey III, 23. He lived in El Paso at the time of his death.
The El Paso Police Department announced in a news release that officers discovered a dead man in a home on the 4000 block of Fillmore Avenue after responding to a welfare check on Wednesday, April 2. Police described the death as “suspicious” but did not give more details.
7News contacted an El Paso Police Department spokesman, who said he could not provide more information or confirm if Lacey was the victim.
Lacey was raised in Sulphur until he was 17, when he was placed in foster care, LeBert said. He graduated from high school in Baton Rouge and entered the military upon graduation.
“He was a very special person,” LeBert said. “I know a lot of people probably say that about their loved ones, but he definitely was. He could make anyone smile or laugh. He was very determined in everything he did, and he had big dreams and big plans for his future, and I know he was very excited to become a dad.”
LeBert said Lacey’s son is to be born within the next month.
She believes Lacey had a kind heart, and it may have led to his death.
She said the family has suspicions about what happened as Lacey was expecting a visit from a friend on Sunday, March 30. That’s the last day LeBert says family spoke with Lacey.
The victim’s family is now desperately searching for answers.
“We are hoping for justice and seeking justice,” LeBert said. “If anything, we want to get his face out there and his actual story. I feel like right now he’s just being labeled as the seventh murder of 2025.”
A
GoFundMe has been created to help with funeral expenses.
